Description: Papyrus. Demotic mythological or narrative text on the recto. Fourteen fragments, of which five are substantial (A-E); four contain a few signs (J-M) and five are uninscribed (F-J). Fragments A and B do not quite join (as mounted) and should be placed very slightly apart. There is an upper margin of 7 cm on fragment A and a bottom margin of 3.5 cm on one of the fragments. Verso: remains of ink (palimpsest?).
Curator's comments: References in the text to Pre, Ptah, the House of the Obelisk (the sun-temple at Heliopolis), Heliopolis and a deity (name in lacuna) of Hermopolis, 'the great god', suggest that this is a mythological text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380995) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380995)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: displaced fragments, fractured Black ink (smudged) Tabbed: kraft paper Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: B Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
